result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter J Seiberlich was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 190 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution in the amount of $7,132.19 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision as follows: $3,728.58 to Acuity Insurance and $3,403.61 to B & T mail services; Restitution as to Anthony B. for lost wages is held open for 60 days; If Anthony B. does not request restitution at that time it will be zero. If restitution is requested the Defense may request a hearing.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Court Costs WAIVED.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling; attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
No possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
DNA sample to be provided if not already done, and also to
pay surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Peter J Seiberlich in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim/witness notification.  

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 8 years (Initial Confinement: 5 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years). Credit for 190 days.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel meeting while on Extended Supervision
- Alcohol Assessment
- Court costs waived
- Restitution in the amount of $7,132.19 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision as follows:  $3,728.58 to Acuity Insurance; $3,403.61 to.  Restitution as to Anthony B. for lost wages is held open for 60 days.  If Anthony B. does not request restitution at that time, restitution as to Anthony B. will be set at zero.  If restitution is requested, the defense may request a restitution hearing.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Peter J Seiberlich in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicole M. Masnica.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Lucas Bennewitz and Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #4 is dismissed by operation of law.  Count #2 and 3 are dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Masnica wishes to proceed to testimony, however the state requests an adjourned date for sentencing due to unavailabilty of victim.  Court adjourns sentencing.  Court will allow victim to appear by telephone or videoconference.   Court revokes bail, pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Character letter filed
